com.github.rtoshiro.view.video

Class FullscreenVideoView

  • java.lang.Object
    • RelativeLayout
      • com.github.rtoshiro.view.video.FullscreenVideoView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullscreenVideoLayout

    public class FullscreenVideoView
extends RelativeLayout
    Acts like a android.widget.VideoView with fullscreen functionality
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    2015.0527
    Author:
    rtoshiro

      • setFullscreen

        public void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Turn VideoView fulllscreen mode on or off.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - true to turn on fullscreen mode or false to turn off
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - In case of mediaPlayer doesn't exist or illegal state exception
        Since:
        1.1

      • setActivity

        public void setActivity(Activity activity)
        Binds an Activity to VideoView. This is necessary to keep tracking on orientation changes
        Parameters:
        activity - The activity that VideoView is related to

      • resize

        public void resize()

      • isShouldAutoplay

        public boolean isShouldAutoplay()
        Tells if application should autoplay videos as soon as it is prepared
        Returns:
        true if application are going to play videos as soon as it is prepared

      • setShouldAutoplay

        public void setShouldAutoplay(boolean shouldAutoplay)
        Tells application that it should begin playing as soon as buffering is ok
        Parameters:
        shouldAutoplay - If true, call start() method when getCurrentState() == PREPARED. Default is false.

      • fullscreen

        @Deprecated
public void fullscreen()
                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Deprecated. As of release 1.1.0, replaced by setFullscreen(boolean)
        Toggles view to fullscreen mode It saves currentState and calls pause() method. When fullscreen is finished, it calls the saved currentState before pause() In practice, it only affects STARTED state. If currenteState was STARTED when fullscreen() is called, it calls start() method after fullscreen() has ended.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • seekTo

        public void seekTo(int msec)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        MediaPlayer method (seekTo) It calls pause() method before calling MediaPlayer.seekTo()
        Parameters:
        msec - the offset in milliseconds from the start to seek to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the internal player engine has not been initialized
        See Also:
        seekTo
